course_info.title: Decision and Risk Analysis for Complex Systems

instructor.name: Earl Sprague
instructor.office_hours: Virtual office hours via Zoom twice a week on Monday and Thursday.

_metadata.course_description: The ability to structure and analyze an effective trade study under conditions of uncertainty and risk is a core systems engineering skill.
learning_outcomes: Explain the basics of probability theory important to decision making
Recognize factors contributing to successful and unsuccessful decisions
Apply a simple model for decision making
Discern the difference between a well-framed problem and a poorly-framed one
Utilize at least two techniques for generating alternatives
Apply at least three techniques for deciding a course of action
Set up a risk/opportunity management plan
Define the difference between risk and issues
Structure and solve decision problems using an engineering trade study approach
